definition: a hard sharp granule (as of sand), material (as many abrasives) composed of such granules
the structure of a stone that adapts it to grinding
the size of abrasive particles usually expressed as their mesh
firmness of mind or spirit : unyielding courage in the face of hardship or danger
examples: managed to survive by his grit and guile

definition: to give forth a grating sound
examples: dry snow gritting beneath our feet

definition: to cause (one's teeth) to grind or grate
examples: gritted his teeth and faced the challenge

definition: to cover or spread with grit, to smooth (a material, such as marble) with a coarse abrasive
